# BRIGAND-CLASS EXPEDITION SHUTTLE
[color=#a4885c]Ship Size:[/color] Medium
[color=#a4885c]Recommended Crew:[/color] 3-6
[color=#a4885c]Power Gen Type:[/color] AME
[color=#a4885c]Expeditions:[/color] Yes
[color=#a4885c]IFF Console:[/color] None
"Civilian conversion of an old military light frigate from the early days of humanity's expansion to the stars. The original light frigate design was made in pre-FTL era of technology. Manufactured by Langstad-Voigt Heavy Industries."
# Tips on running LVHI Brigand shuttles - Optimal [bold]Target Power[/bold] (kW) for the generator unit is [color=#a4885c]35 [bold]kW[/bold][/color]. If you've added additional machines, check shuttle [bold]APC units[/bold] to monitor the shuttle's power draw and adjust the generator's [bold]Target Power[/bold] accordingly. For more general information on the power grid and other life support systems, refer to the [textlink="Power" link="Power"] guidebook article and the [textlink="Preflight Checklist" link="PreflightChecklist"/]. - There are two buttons in the cockpit: the one with a yellow and black frame controls the window shutters. The button with the gray frame controls the mini anchor.
- For the basics of [bold]shuttle piloting[/bold], refer to [textlink="Piloting" link="Piloting"] and [textlink="Sector Topology" link="SectorTopology"/]. - For the basics of [bold]cargo hauling[/bold], refer to [textlink="Cargo Hauling" link="CargoHauling"]. - For the basics of [bold]expedition diving[/bold], refer to [textlink="Expeditions" link="Expeditions"]. - As a Captain of a Nanotrasen vessel, you have the authority to hire, fire, demote, or promote crew members at will, refer to [textlink="Hiring" link="Hiring"] for more information.
